default.title: Mercury Retrograde {year}: Dates, Signs & Calendar
default.h1: Mercury Retrograde {year}: Dates, Signs, and What to Expect
default.description: Discover Mercury retrograde {year}: dates, signs & timing. Learn how to navigate communication, tech & travel disruptions. Complete retrograde guide with calendar.

whatIs.question: When is Mercury Retrograde in {year}?
whatIs.answer: Mercury goes retrograde 3-4 times each year for about 3 weeks per period. These windows are best used for review, revision, and reconnection, with extra care around communication, tech, and travel.

default.intro: Mercury retrograde is a cycle of review. It slows the pace so you can revise plans, reconnect with people, and catch details you usually miss.
default.tldr: Mercury Retrograde {year} includes multiple retrograde periods. Use these windows to revisit unfinished work, double-check messages, and build buffer time for travel and schedules.
default.meaning:
Mercury Retrograde {year} is best understood as timing. When Mercury appears to move backward from Earth’s perspective, everyday Mercury topics can feel less linear.

During Mercury retrograde, you may notice:
- Communication mix-ups and delays
- Tech glitches and missed details
- Schedule changes and travel disruptions
- Old conversations, people, or projects resurfacing

Work with the ‘re-’ energy: review, revise, reflect, reconnect, and reconsider. Plan ahead, slow down, and prioritise clarity over speed.
howToWorkWith: Back up important files and devices before each retrograde begins
Allow extra time for travel and important meetings
Double-check messages, dates, and details before sending
Review agreements carefully and avoid rushing big commitments
Reconnect with old friends, colleagues, or creative projects
Use the time for editing, revising, and completing unfinished work
emotionalThemes: Nostalgia and reflection on the past
Reconnection with people from your history

faqs.question: Should I avoid traveling during Mercury retrograde?
faqs.answer: Travel is still possible, but expect delays or scheduling changes. Build in extra time, double-check reservations, and keep a simple backup plan.

faqs.question: Can I sign contracts during Mercury retrograde?
faqs.answer: If you can, avoid rushing major agreements. If you must sign, read everything carefully, confirm terms in writing, and consider a second review.

faqs.question: How long do Mercury retrograde effects last?
faqs.answer: Some people track a pre-shadow and post-shadow window around the retrograde. Practically: start planning a bit early and keep things flexible for a short period after Mercury stations direct.

default.ctaText: See Mercury retrograde through your chart

2026.title: Mercury Retrograde 2026: Dates, Signs & Calendar
2026.h1: Mercury Retrograde 2026: Dates, Signs, and What to Expect
2026.description: Discover Mercury retrograde 2026: dates, signs & timing. Learn how to navigate communication, tech & travel disruptions. Complete retrograde guide with calendar.

whatIs.question: When is Mercury Retrograde in 2026?
whatIs.answer: Mercury goes retrograde 3-4 times each year for about 3 weeks per period. In 2026, use the calendar below to track each window by date and sign so you can plan ahead.

2026.tldr: Mercury Retrograde 2026 includes multiple retrograde periods. Focus on review, revision, and reconnection, and slow down anything that needs clean communication or precise timing.
2026.meaning:
Mercury Retrograde 2026 is timing you can plan around. Mercury topics can feel less linear, so build buffer time, confirm details, and treat this as a revision season rather than a sprint.

Common Mercury retrograde themes:
- Communication mix-ups and delays
- Tech glitches and overlooked details
- Schedule shifts and travel disruptions
- Old stories resurfacing for closure

Use the ‘re-’ energy: review, revise, reflect, reconnect, and reconsider.
howToWorkWith: Back up all digital files and devices before retrograde begins
Allow extra time for travel and important meetings
Double-check messages, dates, and details before sending
Review agreements carefully and avoid rushing big commitments
Reconnect with old friends, colleagues, or creative projects
Practice patience with technology and communication issues
Use the time for editing, revising, and completing unfinished work
emotionalThemes: Nostalgia and reflection on the past
Reconnection with people from your history
Liberation through letting go of outdated patterns

faqs.question: Should I avoid traveling during Mercury Retrograde 2026?
faqs.answer: Travel is still possible, but expect delays or booking errors. Build in extra time, double-check reservations, and keep a simple backup plan.

faqs.question: Can I sign contracts during Mercury Retrograde?
faqs.answer: If possible, avoid rushing major agreements. If you must sign, read everything carefully, confirm terms in writing, and consider a third party review.

faqs.question: How long before Mercury goes direct do effects last?
faqs.answer: Many people notice a lead-in and wind-down period around the exact retrograde dates. Practically: start planning early and keep things flexible shortly after Mercury stations direct.

default.title: Mars Retrograde {year}: Dates, Signs & Calendar
default.h1: Mars Retrograde {year}: Dates, Signs, and What to Expect
default.description: Discover Mars retrograde {year}: dates, signs & action themes. Learn how to navigate energy, motivation & conflict during Mars retrograde. Complete guide with calendar.

whatIs.question: When is Mars Retrograde in {year}?
whatIs.answer: Mars retrograde happens approximately every 2 years and lasts about 2-2.5 months. It's a time to reassess how you take action, handle conflict, and direct your energy.

default.intro: Mars retrograde slows down forward momentum. It's a time to review your approach to action, anger, and ambition rather than charging ahead.
default.tldr: Mars Retrograde {year} is a period for reassessing how you take action and direct energy. Avoid starting major conflicts or aggressive new ventures. Review what drives you.
default.meaning:
Mars Retrograde {year} asks you to reconsider your approach to action and assertion. Progress may feel slower, and frustration can build if you push too hard.

During Mars retrograde, you may notice:
- Decreased energy or motivation
- Frustration with delays and obstacles
- Old conflicts resurfacing
- Questions about what you're fighting for

Use this time to reassess your goals and how you pursue them.
howToWorkWith: Avoid starting major conflicts or confrontations
Review fitness routines and energy management
Reflect on what truly motivates you
Be patient with delays and setbacks
Channel frustration into constructive review

faqs.question: Should I avoid exercise during Mars retrograde?
faqs.answer: No, but you may need to adjust intensity. Listen to your body and avoid pushing through fatigue.

faqs.question: Is Mars retrograde a bad time to start projects?
faqs.answer: Major new initiatives may face more obstacles. It's better for reviewing and refining existing projects.

default.ctaText: See Mars retrograde through your chart

default.title: {year} Retrograde Calendar: All Planetary Retrogrades
default.h1: {year} Retrograde Calendar: Complete Guide to All Retrogrades
default.description: Complete {year} retrograde calendar with all planetary retrogrades: Mercury, Venus, Mars, Jupiter, Saturn, Uranus, Neptune, Pluto. Dates, signs & meanings.

whatIs.question: How many retrogrades happen in {year}?
whatIs.answer: {year} has {retrogradeCount} retrograde periods: {mercuryRxCount} Mercury retrogrades, plus Venus, Mars, and {outerRxCount} outer planet retrogrades (Jupiter through Pluto).

default.intro: {year} features {retrogradeCount} retrograde periods. Each planet's retrograde brings different themes - Mercury affects communication, Venus affects relationships, Mars affects action, and outer planets affect longer-term cycles.
default.tldr: {year} Retrograde Calendar: {mercuryRxCount} Mercury retrogrades, {outerRxCount} outer planet retrogrades, plus any Venus or Mars retrogrades. Use this calendar to plan around review periods.
default.meaning:
Planetary retrogrades in {year} offer windows for reflection and revision. While they can bring delays, they also provide valuable opportunities to reassess and refine.

**Personal Planet Retrogrades:**
- Mercury (3-4x/year): Communication, tech, travel
- Venus (~every 18 months): Love, values, finances
- Mars (~every 2 years): Action, energy, conflict

**Outer Planet Retrogrades (annual):**
- Jupiter: Growth, expansion, beliefs
- Saturn: Structure, responsibility, limits
- Uranus: Change, innovation, rebellion
- Neptune: Dreams, intuition, spirituality
- Pluto: Transformation, power, depth
howToWorkWith: Track which planets are retrograde at any given time
Plan major decisions around direct periods when possible
Use retrograde periods for review, revision, and completion
Pay attention to themes from the past resurfacing
Slow down and avoid rushing important matters

faqs.question: How many retrogrades happen each year?
faqs.answer: Mercury retrogrades 3-4 times, Venus and Mars each retrograde once every 1-2 years, and all outer planets (Jupiter through Pluto) retrograde once annually for several months each.

faqs.question: Are retrogrades always bad?
faqs.answer: No. Retrogrades are simply periods of review. They can be productive for finishing projects, reconnecting with the past, and refining your approach.

default.ctaText: See how retrogrades affect your chart

default.title: Venus Retrograde {year}: Dates, Signs & Calendar
default.h1: Venus Retrograde {year}: Dates, Signs, and What It Brings Up
default.description: Discover Venus retrograde {year}: dates, signs & relationship themes. Learn how to navigate love, values & financial shifts. Complete retrograde guide with calendar.

whatIs.question: When is Venus Retrograde in {year}?
whatIs.answer: Venus retrograde happens about every 18 months and lasts roughly 6 weeks. It is a time to reassess relationships, values, and financial priorities, rather than rushing new commitments.

default.intro: Venus retrograde turns the focus inward. It highlights relationship patterns, value alignment, and what you truly want to invest in.
default.tldr: Venus Retrograde {year} is a review cycle for love, money, and values. Use it to reassess priorities, repair what matters, and slow down big relationship or spending decisions when possible.
default.meaning:
Venus Retrograde {year} is a reflective period for love, values, and money. Old dynamics may resurface, priorities can shift, and you may see what you truly value with more clarity.

Use this time to review:
- Relationship patterns and boundaries
- Spending habits and financial priorities
- Creative direction and aesthetic choices
- What feels nourishing and aligned
howToWorkWith: Reflect on relationship dynamics and unmet needs
Reassess your values and spending habits
Reconnect with creative projects you paused
Practise patience with romantic decisions
Focus on self-worth and inner alignment
emotionalThemes: A desire to slow down in love

faqs.question: Should I start a new relationship during Venus retrograde?
faqs.answer: It is generally better to avoid major new commitments during Venus retrograde. Use the time to reflect and revisit what you truly want.

faqs.question: Does Venus retrograde affect finances?
faqs.answer: Yes. It is a useful time to review spending habits and avoid large purchases that may not feel aligned later.

default.ctaText: See Venus retrograde through your chart

default.title: {year} Eclipses: Dates, Signs & Eclipse Calendar
default.h1: {year} Eclipses: Dates, Signs, and Eclipse Season Themes
default.description: Discover {year} eclipses: solar & lunar eclipse dates, signs & themes. Learn how to navigate eclipse season for transformation & new beginnings. Complete eclipse guide.

whatIs.question: How many eclipses occur in {year}?
whatIs.answer: There are {eclipseCount} eclipses in {year}: {solarEclipseCount} solar and {lunarEclipseCount} lunar. Eclipses are turning points that accelerate change and bring key themes to the surface.

default.intro: Eclipses bring accelerated change. {year} features {eclipseCount} eclipses that highlight what needs to be released or begun.
default.tldr: {year} has {eclipseCount} eclipses ({solarEclipseCount} solar, {lunarEclipseCount} lunar). Use the calendar to track dates and signs, and keep plans flexible around eclipse season.
default.meaning:
Eclipses in {year} mark pivotal moments of change. Unlike regular full and new moons, eclipses tend to amplify themes and move stories forward.

Solar eclipses (new moons amplified):
- New beginnings and fresh starts
- Unexpected opportunities
- Doors opening that were previously closed

Lunar eclipses (full moons amplified):
- Culminations and endings
- Emotional revelations
- Releasing what no longer serves you
howToWorkWith: Avoid forcing major decisions during the eclipse peak window
Surrender to what is changing rather than controlling outcomes
Journal about what needs to be released (lunar) or begun (solar)
Rest and reduce over-scheduling during eclipse season
Pay attention to themes emerging within 2 weeks of each eclipse
emotionalThemes: Fatigue and the need for extra rest

faqs.question: Can I manifest during an eclipse?
faqs.answer: Many traditions advise keeping manifestation gentle during eclipses because the energy can feel volatile. Observe what emerges and set intentions once things settle.

faqs.question: How long do eclipse effects last?
faqs.answer: Eclipse themes can unfold for months. Some shifts appear within 2 weeks, while others reveal their full story over a longer arc.

faqs.question: Why do I feel tired during eclipses?
faqs.answer: Eclipse season can coincide with intense emotional processing and disrupted routines. Treat it like a high-signal window: rest more, and simplify where you can.

default.ctaText: See how {year} eclipses affect your birth chart

Rest and reduce over-scheduling during eclipse season

default.title: {year} Equinoxes & Solstices: Dates & Astrological Meaning
default.description: Discover {year} equinoxes and solstices: exact dates, astrological significance, and rituals. Navigate seasonal transitions with precision timing.

whatIs.question: What are the equinoxes and solstices in {year}?
whatIs.answer: {year} features 4 seasonal turning points: Spring Equinox (Sun enters Aries), Summer Solstice (Sun enters Cancer), Fall Equinox (Sun enters Libra), and Winter Solstice (Sun enters Capricorn). These mark the astronomical start of each season.

default.intro: Equinoxes and solstices mark the Sun's journey through the zodiac and the natural rhythm of the seasons. These are powerful times for ritual, reflection, and aligning with nature's cycles.
default.tldr: {year} Seasonal Calendar: 2 equinoxes (equal day and night) and 2 solstices (longest and shortest days). Use these dates for seasonal rituals, intention setting, and aligning with natural rhythms.
default.meaning:
The equinoxes and solstices in {year} are astronomical events that have been honored across cultures for millennia.

**Equinoxes** (equal day and night):
- Spring Equinox: New beginnings, planting seeds, fresh starts
- Fall Equinox: Harvest, gratitude, finding balance

**Solstices** (extremes of light):
- Summer Solstice: Peak energy, abundance, celebration
- Winter Solstice: Return of light, introspection, rebirth

These dates also mark the Sun's entry into cardinal signs, initiating new astrological seasons.
howToWorkWith: Create seasonal rituals to mark each transition
Set intentions aligned with the seasonal energy
Spend time in nature during these powerful days
Reflect on what you want to release or cultivate
Honor the balance of light and dark in your life
emotionalThemes: Reflection on the passing of time

faqs.question: What is the difference between an equinox and a solstice?
faqs.answer: Equinoxes occur when day and night are roughly equal length (spring and fall). Solstices occur at the extremes - summer solstice has the longest day, winter solstice has the longest night.

faqs.question: Why are equinoxes and solstices important in astrology?
faqs.answer: They mark the Sun's entry into cardinal signs (Aries, Cancer, Libra, Capricorn), which initiates new seasons and brings powerful energy for new beginnings and major life shifts.

faqs.question: What rituals can I do during equinoxes and solstices?
faqs.answer: Common practices include altar work, intention setting, gratitude ceremonies, nature walks, meditation at sunrise or sunset, and seasonal celebrations with community.

default.ctaText: See how seasonal shifts affect your chart
